title: Trundle: BORK, Hydra or Trinity Force?
body:
I see that these are the three main ways that players build Trundle, and since I am starting to main him i wanted to ask in what situation would you pick which item? I know that after one of these items you would go full tank, or if your really ahead just get more damage for the lols which I have done after being stupidly ahead numerous times. I want to know the pros and cons of picking each of those items, or any other alternative item that works? What would be the best choice for Trundle? I usually go with BORK because i love the attack speed for split pushing and the active slow on it to stick to your enemy, but are any items more optimal on Trundle?

Post your opinions ty {{champion:48}}

replies.body:
**Disclaimer: I don't main Trundle (I'm not expert) and have only played 16 games with him.**

Match History here: http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-history/NA/38509083?champion=48

I've never tried {{item:3078}}  just because I think the item is cheap and super powerful on everyone. I imagine it would be a great pick **once** you finish it.
The problem with rushing Trinity Force is that its expensive and takes quite awhile to finish in the "normal" circumstance; not stomping your lane opponent.
It has great synergy with Chomp (Q), like any auto attack modifying ability Wukong Q, Irelia Q, Rengar Q, Nasus Q, etc. So I wouldn't classify it at all as a "horrible" item on Trundle. Rage passive lets you kite the enemy top laner and chase people down really quickly with the Pillar and Frozen Ground. You can also benefit from all of its statistics; Trundle's ultimate as you might have already noticed has AP scaling.
Phage and Sheen work perfectly with Chomp (Q). 

{{item:3153}} Is pretty awesome of Trundle. I think it's a core on him because of his very heavy reliance on basic attacks. Trundle has trouble at getting kited by ADCs and what not and this helps a little bit. It's a tank killing item as well, goes well with your ultimate might as well be in the ability. 

{{item:3074}} is great but it doesn't give attack speed. It's still a good item on him because basic attacks. The item is really just for splitpushing and for AoE damage that Trundle lacks. I usually couple this with BotRK for epic duelling potential during lane phase because Trundle has very tank-like base stats already. Sometimes, when versing a counter/ranged champion {{champion:67}} {{champion:85}} {{champion:133}} etc I leave it out in favour of tank items. 
If you're jungling with Trundle I'd take the Tiamat part *really* early for the clear speed.

In saying these. Keep in mind **everything is situational!** Don't follow a single build path because games change and things happen. 
____
If you're wondering why I took needlessly large rod or any hard AP items on a match, it's because I was stomping the match and was fooling around with trying to optimise my ult.

My last game... {{champion:39}}.
She's so stronk!

BOTRK and Triforce are great items in combination on Trundle.
Considering how often you will be using your Q and that it procs both BOTRK's passive and the Spell Blade effect of Triforce they work great together.

Rage and BORTK's active also help Trundle in his ability to kite and deal with his weakness to being kited.

The crit chance that Triforce gives can also be pretty sweet as Trundle's Q can crit, and hurts like a bitch when it does.

My build on Trundle usually consists of BOTRK and Triforce as core items, and then going tanky from that point. Spirit Visage is practically a must.

Hydra
Pro: AoE split push
Con: Less dueling power

BotRK
Pro: Massive Dueling power
Con: Less split push power (negligible given your trundle)

Triforce is one i can't really think as to why you'd buy it unless your super ahead and planning to go 2 offense items then tank.
